Description: A unique identifier for each person.
A foreign key that refers to an identifier in the CONCEPT table for the unique gender of the person.
possible values: "45878463 - Female\n45880669 - Male\n2000000002 - Not man only; not woman only; prefer not to answer or skipped"

Description: The date and time of birth of the person.
A foreign key that refers to an identifier in the CONCEPT table for the unique race of the person, belonging to the 'Race' vocabulary.
possible values:
"8527 - White; 8516 - Black or African American
2100000001 - None Indicated
903096 - PMI: Skip
8515 - Asian
2000000008 - More than one population
45882607 - None of these
1177221 - I prefer not to answer
2000000001 - Another single population"

Description: A foreign key that refers to the standard concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the ethnicity of the person, belonging to the 'Ethnicity' vocabulary.
possible values:
38003564 - Not Hispanic or Latino
38003563 - Hispanic or Latino
903096 - PMI: Skip
1586148 - Race Ethnicity None Of These
903079 - PMI: Prefer Not To Answer

Description: A foreign key identifier to the Person for whom the condition is recorded. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.
The date and time when the instance of the Condition start is recorded.
The date when the instance of the Condition is considered to have ended.
A foreign key identifier to the Person for whom the visit is recorded. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.
A foreign key identifier to the Person who is subjected to the Drug. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

The start date and time for the current instance of Drug utilization. Valid entries include a start datetime of a prescription, the date and time a prescription was filled, or the date and time on which a Drug administration procedure was recorded.

The end date and time for the current instance of Drug utilization. Depending on different sources, it could be a known or an inferred date and time and denotes the last day at which the patient was still exposed to Drug.
The known end date of a drug_exposure as provided by the source.
A foreign key to a standard concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the drug concept.
The name of the standard concept in the Standardized Vocabularies to which the drug is mapped.
A foreign key identifier to the Person about whom the measurement was recorded. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.

The date and time of the Measurement. Some database systems don't have a datatype of time. To accommodate all temporal analyses, datatype datetime can be used (combining measurement_date and measurement_time forum discussion)
A foreign key to the standard concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the measurement concept.
The value of the measurement as a number.
A foreign key identifier to the Person who is subjected to the Procedure. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.
The date on which the Procedure was performed.
The date and time on which the Procedure was performed.
A foreign key to the standard concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the procedure concept.
A foreign key identifier to the Person about whom the observation was recorded. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.
A foreign key to the standard observation concept identifier code in the Standardized Vocabularies.
The date and time of the observation.
A foreign key identifier to the person for whom the observation period is defined. The demographic details of that person are stored in the person table
The start date of the observation period for which data are available from the data source
The end date of the observation period for which data are available from the data source
A foreign key identifier to the Person who is subjected to the Device. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.
The date the Device or supply was applied or used.
The date and time the Device or supply was applied or used.
The date use of the Device or supply was ceased.
The date and time use of the Device or supply was ceased.
A foreign key identifier to the deceased person. The demographic details of that person are stored in the person table.
A foreign key identifier to the Person for whom the condition is recorded. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON and ds_PERSON tables.
A foreign key to the date and time when the instance of the Condition is recorded.
A foreign key to the date and time when the instance of the Condition is considered to have ended.
A foreign key identifier to the Person for whom the drug is recorded. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON and ds_PERSON tables.

A foreign key to the start date and time for the current instance of Drug utilization. Valid entries include a start datetime of a prescription, the date and time a prescription was filled, or the date and time on which a Drug administration procedure was recorded.

A foreign key to the end date and time for the current instance of Drug utilization. Depending on different sources, it could be a known or an inferred date and time and denotes the last day at which the patient was still exposed to Drug.
A foreign key to the known end date of the Drug Exposure as provided by the source.
A foreign key identifier to the Person for whom the measurement is recorded. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON and ds_PERSON tables.
A foreign key to the date and time of the Measurement. Some database systems don't have a datatype of time.
A foreign key identifier to the Person for whom the observation is recorded. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON and ds_PERSON tables.
A foreign key to the standard observation concept identifier code in the Standardized Vocabularies.
A foreign key to the date and time at which the Observation was made.
A foreign key to the observation code as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a Standard Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is, stored here for reference.
A foreign key identifier to the Person. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON and ds_PERSON tables.
A foreign key that refers to an identifier in the CONCEPT table for the unique gender of the person.
The gender of the Person corresponding to the value of gender_concept_id as it appears in the source data.
A foreign key to the date and time of birth of the person.
A foreign key that refers to an identifier in the CONCEPT table for the unique race of the Person, belonging to the 'Race' vocabulary.
The race of the Person corresponding to the value of race_concept_id as it appears in the source data.
A foreign key that refers to the standard concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies for the ethnicity of the person, belonging to the 'Ethnicity' vocabulary.
The ethnicity of the person corresponding to the value of ethnicity_concept_id as it appears in the source data.
A foreign key identifier to the Person for whom the procedure is recorded. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON and ds_PERSON tables.
A foreign key to the date and time on which the Procedure was performed.
